---
title: "Batch Call"
api: "POST /initiateBatchCall"
description: "Call multiple contacts at once with JSON payload (up to 1000 contacts)"
---

## Quick Start

Need to call multiple people? This endpoint lets you initiate up to **1000 calls** in a single request. Perfect for campaigns, notifications, or bulk outreach.

<CardGroup cols={3}>
  <Card title="Up to 1000" icon="users">
    Call up to 1000 contacts in one request
  </Card>
  <Card title="Personalized" icon="bullseye">
    Each contact gets custom metadata
  </Card>
  <Card title="Real-time" icon="chart-line">
    Get instant batch processing status
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

<Note>
  **Call Processing Time:** Receiving calls on your phone numbers can take up to 30 seconds from the telephony dialer's side.
</Note>

---

## Headers

<ParamField header="Content-Type" type="string" default="application/json">
  Set to application/json for JSON requests
</ParamField>


<ParamField header="Origin" type="string">
  Origin of the request (must be whitelisted)
  
  Example: `vb-seamless-dev-backend.oriserve.com/`
</ParamField>

---

## Request Body

<ParamField body="campaignId" type="string" required>
  Campaign ID that links all calls to a specific campaign
  
  Example: `b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac`
</ParamField>

<ParamField body="notificationWebhookUrl" type="string" default="https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback">
  Webhook URL for batch processing updates (optional)
  
  â†³ [View complete webhook response documentation](#notificationwebhookurl-response)
</ParamField>

<ParamField
  body="users"
  type="array"object
  required
  default='[{"userName": "Rajesh Kumar", "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210", "metaData": {"customer_id": "CUST_12345", "due_amount": "25000", "company_name": "HDFC Bank"}}]'
>
  Array of user objects to call (max 1000 users) *A default user "Rajesh Kumar"
  will be pre-filled in the playground for easy testing.*
</ParamField>

<Info>
  **Default User Preview:**
  ```json
  {
    "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
    "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",
    "metaData": {
      "customer_id": "CUST_12345", 
      "due_amount": "25000",
      "company_name": "HDFC Bank"
    }
  }
  ```
  This user will be automatically filled in the API playground. You can modify it or add more users as needed.
</Info>

### Request Body Structure

Each user in the `users` array should have:

- `userName` (string, required) - Contact's full name
- `userPhoneNumber` (string, required) - Phone number with country code, no + prefix
- `metaData` (object, optional) - Custom data for the AI agent

### Phone Number Format Guidelines

<Info>
  **Phone Number Format:** - **India:** `919876543210` (91 + 10 digits) -
  **USA/Canada:** `14155551234` (1 + 10 digits) - **UK:** `447700123456` (44 +
  7700123456) - **UAE:** `971501234567` (971 + 9 digits) - **Always include
  country code, never use + prefix**
</Info>

<Warning>
  **Limit:** Maximum 1000 users per request. For larger lists, use the [file
  upload endpoint](/api-reference/third-party/initiate-batch-call-using-sheet).
</Warning>

## Request Body Examples

### Minimal Example

```json
{
  "campaignId": "b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac",
  "users": [
    {
      "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
      "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210"
    }
  ]
}
```

### Complete Example with metaData

```json
{
  "campaignId": "b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac",
  "notificationWebhookUrl": "https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback",
  "users": [
    {
      "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
      "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",
      "metaData": {
        "customer_id": "CUST_12345",
        "due_amount": "25000",
        "company_name": "HDFC Bank"
      }
    },
    {
      "userName": "John Smith",
      "userPhoneNumber": "14155551234",
      "metaData": {
        "customer_id": "CUST_67890",
        "due_amount": "15000",
        "company_name": "Chase Bank"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

<RequestExample>
```json
{
  "campaignId": "b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929acssss",
  "notificationWebhookUrl": "https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback",
  "users": [
    {
      "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
      "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",
      "metaData": {
        "customer_id": "CUST_12345",
        "account_number": "ACC789123456",
        "due_amount": "25000",
        "due_date": "2025-12-15",
        "loan_type": "Personal Loan",
        "company_name": "HDFC Bank",
        "branch_code": "HDFC001",
        "payment_reminder": "true",
        "language_preference": "Hindi",
        "last_payment_date": "2025-10-15",
        "overdue_days": "24",
        "contact_attempt": "3"
      }
    },
    {
      "userName": "John Smith",
      "userPhoneNumber": "14155551234",
      "metaData": {
        "customer_id": "CUST_67890",
        "account_number": "ACC456789123",
        "due_amount": "15000",
        "due_date": "2025-11-28",
        "loan_type": "Auto Loan",
        "company_name": "Chase Bank",
        "branch_code": "CHASE_NYC",
        "payment_reminder": "false",
        "language_preference": "English",
        "last_payment_date": "2025-09-28",
        "overdue_days": "15",
        "contact_attempt": "2"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```
</RequestExample>

---

## Response

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Success">
    **Batch processing started successfully!**
    
    <CodeGroup>
    ```json 200 OK - Single User
    {
      "success": true,
      "message": "Batch call initiated successfully",
      "data": {
        "total_users": 1,
        "calls_initiated": 1,
        "calls_failed": 0,
        "batch_id": "batch_abc123",
        "calls": [
          {
            "call_uuid": "call-uuid-001",
            "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
            "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",
            "status": "initiated"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
    ```
    
    ```json 200 OK - Multiple Users
    {
      "success": true,
      "message": "Batch call initiated successfully",
      "data": {
        "total_users": 4,
        "calls_initiated": 3,
        "calls_failed": 1,
        "batch_id": "batch_xyz789",
        "calls": [
          {
            "call_uuid": "call-uuid-001",
            "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
            "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",
            "status": "initiated"
          },
          {
            "call_uuid": "call-uuid-002", 
            "userName": "John Smith",
            "userPhoneNumber": "14155551234",
            "status": "initiated"
          },
          {
            "call_uuid": "call-uuid-003",
            "userName": "Sarah Johnson", 
            "userPhoneNumber": "447700123456",
            "status": "initiated"
          },
          {
            "call_uuid": null,
            "userName": "Invalid User",
            "userPhoneNumber": "invalid_number",
            "status": "failed",
            "error": "Invalid phone number format"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
    ```
    </CodeGroup>
    
    **Key Fields:**
    - **total_users** - Number of users in your request
    - **calls_initiated** - Successfully started calls  
    - **calls_failed** - Failed calls (invalid numbers, etc.)
    - **batch_id** - Track this batch in webhooks/analytics
    - **calls** - Individual call details with UUIDs for tracking
    
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Error">
    **Something went wrong:**
    
    <CodeGroup>
    ```json 400 - Invalid Users Array
    {
      "success": false,
      "message": "Invalid users array",
      "error": "Users array cannot be empty"
    }
    ```
    
    ```json 400 - Invalid Phone Number
    {
      "success": false,
      "message": "Invalid phone number format",
      "error": "Phone number '91962514709' is invalid. Must be 10-15 digits with country code (no + prefix)"
    }
    ```
    
    ```json 413 - Too Many Users
    {
      "success": false,
      "message": "Too many users",
      "error": "Maximum 1000 users allowed per batch"
    }
    ```
    
    ```json 401 - Authentication Failed
    {
      "success": false,
      "message": "Authentication failed", 
      "error": "Invalid or expired token"
    }
    ```
    
    ```json 422 - Validation Error
    {
      "success": false,
      "message": "Validation failed",
      "error": "Missing required field: userName for user at index 2"
    }
    ```
    </CodeGroup>
    
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

---

## Phone Number Validation

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card title="Valid Formats" icon="check">
    **Correct Examples:** - `919625147093` (India) - `14155551234` (USA/Canada)
    - `447700123456` (UK) - `971501234567` (UAE) - `33123456789` (France) -
    `61423456789` (Australia)
  </Card>

  <Card title="Invalid Formats" icon="x">
    **Incorrect Examples:** - `+919625147093` (has + prefix) - `9625147093`
    (missing country code) - `91-962-514-7093` (has dashes) - `91 962 514 7093`
    (has spaces) - `abc123456789` (contains letters)
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

<Note>
  **Pro Tip:** Always include the country code without the + prefix. The system
  will automatically validate and format the number for optimal delivery rates.
</Note>

---

## NotificationWebHookUrl Response

When you provide a `notificationWebhookUrl`, the system will send POST requests to your endpoint with detailed call completion data.

### Response Payload Structure

Your webhook endpoint will receive different payloads based on the call status:

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Completed Call">
    **Successful call with full conversation data:**
    
    ```json
    {
      "referenceId": "6910b30a492fd81ae3b17a70",
      "callId": "2c52293f-53cc-487f-aead-4d55bf8baf3b",
      "postCallAnalysisResults": {
        "intent": "NA",
        "disposition": "yes", 
        "app_status": "NA",
        "account_status": "NA",

        "incentive_details": "NA",

        "user_reaction": "NA",
        "connected": "NA",

        "agent_name": "NA",

        "dnd_intent": "No",

        "callback_date": "na",

      },
      "conversationLogs": [
        {
          "CallId": "2c52293f-53cc-487f-aead-4d55bf8baf3b",
          "UserQuery": "Yes. Yes.",

          "UserQuery": "Yes. You are speaking with, please.",
          "BotResponse": "\nGreat!",
          "ConversationLogId": "6910b340359ea8b48c2f65ed",

          "BotResponseTimeStamp": "2025-11-09T15:28:54.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "customerSpecificdetails": {
        "name": "Faiz",
        "phone_number": "919625147093",
        "contactId": "690f62c4ef2fc0e2d66eefb3",

      "callRecordingUrl": "https://aps1.media.plivo.com/v1/Account/MAMWZLZTJIYZKWYJLHYM/Recording/9c79dbdb-9a54-4bc5-9d7a-fa7809967af9.mp3"
    }
    ```
    
  </Tab>
  <Tab title="Busy/CallCut">
    **Call failed due to busy line, or call cut:**
    
    ```json
    {
      "referenceId": "691187352caac6453810448c",
      "callId": "af7b5038-61bf-4cb3-9737-72c5bb8b2429",

      "conversationLogs": [],
      "customerSpecificdetails": {

        "campaignRecordId": "691187352caac6453810448c"

      "callRecordingUrl": ""

    {
      "referenceId": "691188b52caac64538104571",
      "callId": "78fbabf5-d8a9-45ab-8c1e-2c9a2c2d6bd6",
      "postCallAnalysisResults": {},
      "conversationLogs": [],
      "customerSpecificdetails": {
        "name": "Faiz",
        "phone_number": "919625147093",
        "contactId": "690f62c4ef2fc0e2d66eefb3",
        "loan_number": 213,
        "notificationWebhookUrl": "https://overindulgently-unbreezy-colleen.ngrok-free.dev/getCallbackdata",
        "campaignId": "246eb08f-ab16-4e31-a7d5-dd1c9b2bc3d0",
        "campaignRecordId": "691188b52caac64538104571"
      },
      "callDuration": 0,
      "callStatus": "no-answer",
      "callRecordingUrl": ""
    }
    ```
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

### Webhook Payload Fields

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Core Call Data" icon="phone">
    - **referenceId** - Unique reference ID for the call record
    - **callId** - Unique UUID for this specific call
    - **callDuration** - Call duration in seconds
    - **callStatus** - Final call status (completed, failed, no-answer, busy, etc.)
    - **callRecordingUrl** - Direct URL to the call recording (MP3 format)
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Post-Call Analysis" icon="chart-line">
    The `postCallAnalysisResults` object contains AI-powered analysis of the call:
    - **user_sentiment** - Customer sentiment (Positive, Negative, Neutral)
    - **interest_level** - Level of customer interest (Interested, Not Interested, Neutral)
    - **dnd_intent** - Whether customer requested Do Not Disturb (Yes, No)
    - **call_sumary** - AI-generated summary of the conversation
    - **disposition** - Call outcome classification
    - **callback_date/callback_time** - If customer requested callback
    - **connected** - Whether call was successfully connected
    - **voicemail_flow_detected** - If voicemail was detected
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Conversation Logs" icon="message">
    The `conversationLogs` array contains the complete conversation transcript:
    - **CallId** - Links to the main call
    - **UserQuery** - What the customer said
    - **BotResponse** - How the AI agent responded
    - **ConversationLogId** - Unique ID for this exchange
    - **BotResponseTimeStamp** - When the response was generated
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Customer Details" icon="user">
    The `customerSpecificdetails` object contains:
    - **name** - Customer name from your request
    - **phone_number** - Customer phone number
    - **contactId** - Internal contact ID
    - **campaignId** - The campaign this call belongs to
    - **campaignRecordId** - Specific record ID within the campaign
    - **notificationWebhookUrl** - The webhook URL (for verification)
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

### Webhook Endpoint Implementation

Your webhook endpoint should be prepared to handle these POST requests:

<CodeGroup>
```javascript Node.js/Express
app.post('/batch-callback', (req, res) => {
  const callData = req.body;
  
  console.log(`Call ${callData.callId} completed`);
  console.log(`Status: ${callData.callStatus}`);
  console.log(`Duration: ${callData.callDuration} seconds`);
  console.log(`Sentiment: ${callData.postCallAnalysisResults.user_sentiment}`);
  
  // Process the call results
  processCallResults(callData);
  
  // Always respond with 200 OK
  res.status(200).json({ received: true });
});

function processCallResults(callData) {
  // Store call results in your database
  // Update customer records
  // Trigger follow-up actions based on sentiment/interest
  // Download and store call recordings if needed
}
```

```python Python/Flask
from flask import Flask, request, jsonify

@app.route('/batch-callback', methods=['POST'])
def handle_batch_callback():
    call_data = request.json
    
    print(f"Call {call_data['callId']} completed")
    print(f"Status: {call_data['callStatus']}")
    print(f"Duration: {call_data['callDuration']} seconds")
    print(f"Sentiment: {call_data['postCallAnalysisResults']['user_sentiment']}")
    
    # Process the call results
    process_call_results(call_data)
    
    # Always respond with 200 OK
    return jsonify({"received": True}), 200

def process_call_results(call_data):
    # Store call results in your database
    # Update customer records  
    # Trigger follow-up actions based on sentiment/interest
    # Download and store call recordings if needed
    pass
```

```php PHP
<?php
if ($_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] === 'POST') {
    $callData = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true);
    
    echo "Call " . $callData['callId'] . " completed\n";
    echo "Status: " . $callData['callStatus'] . "\n";
    echo "Duration: " . $callData['callDuration'] . " seconds\n";
    echo "Sentiment: " . $callData['postCallAnalysisResults']['user_sentiment'] . "\n";
    
    // Process the call results
    processCallResults($callData);
    
    // Always respond with 200 OK
    http_response_code(200);
    echo json_encode(['received' => true]);
}

function processCallResults($callData) {
    // Store call results in your database
    // Update customer records
    // Trigger follow-up actions based on sentiment/interest  
    // Download and store call recordings if needed
}
?>
```
</CodeGroup>

<Note>
**Important:** Your webhook endpoint must respond with HTTP 200 status code to confirm receipt. Failing to respond properly may result in retry attempts.
</Note>

<Tip>
**Pro Tips for Webhook Handling:**
- **Validate webhook data** before processing
- **Store call recordings** locally if needed for compliance
- **Use sentiment analysis** to prioritize follow-up calls
- **Set up retry logic** in case your endpoint is temporarily unavailable
- **Log webhook failures** for debugging
</Tip>

---

## Code Examples

<CodeGroup>
```bash cURL
curl -X POST "https://vb-seamless-dev-backend.oriserve.com/initiateBatchCall" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" \
  -d '{
    "campaignId": "b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac",
    "notificationWebhookUrl": "https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback",
    "users": [
      {
        "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
        "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",
        "metaData": {
          "customer_id": "CUST_12345",
          "account_number": "ACC789123456",
          "due_amount": "25000",
          "due_date": "2025-12-15",
          "loan_type": "Personal Loan",
          "company_name": "HDFC Bank",
          "branch_code": "HDFC001",
          "payment_reminder": "true",
          "language_preference": "Hindi",
          "last_payment_date": "2025-10-15",
          "overdue_days": "24",
          "contact_attempt": "3"
        }
      },
      {
        "userName": "John Smith", 
        "userPhoneNumber": "14155551234",
        "metaData": {
          "customer_id": "CUST_67890",
          "account_number": "ACC456789123",
          "due_amount": "15000",
          "due_date": "2025-11-28",
          "loan_type": "Auto Loan",
          "company_name": "Chase Bank",
          "branch_code": "CHASE_NYC",
          "payment_reminder": "false",
          "language_preference": "English",
          "last_payment_date": "2025-09-28",
          "overdue_days": "15",
          "contact_attempt": "2"
        }
      }
    ]
  }'
```

```javascript JavaScript/Node.js
const axios = require("axios");

async function initiateBatchCall(
  campaignId,
  users,
  notificationWebhookUrl = null
) {
  try {
    const payload = {
      campaignId: campaignId,
      users: users,
    };

    if (notificationWebhookUrl) {
      payload.notificationWebhookUrl = notificationWebhookUrl;
    }

    const response = await axios.post(
      "https://vb-seamless-dev-backend.oriserve.com/initiateBatchCall",
      payload,
      {
        headers: {
          "Content-Type": "application/json",
          Authorization: "Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE",
        },
      }
    );

    console.log(
      `${response.data.data.calls_initiated} calls initiated successfully`
    );
    console.log(`Batch ID: ${response.data.data.batch_id}`);

    return response.data.data;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Batch call failed:", error.response?.data || error.message);
    throw error;
  }
}

// Example usage with multiple international numbers
const users = [
  {
    userName: "Rajesh Kumar",
    userPhoneNumber: "919876543210", // India
    metaData: {
      customer_id: "CUST_12345",
      account_number: "ACC789123456",
      due_amount: "25000",
      due_date: "2025-12-15",
      loan_type: "Personal Loan",
      company_name: "HDFC Bank",
    },
  },
  {
    userName: "John Smith",
    userPhoneNumber: "14155551234", // USA
    metaData: {
      customer_id: "CUST_67890",
      account_number: "ACC456789123",
      due_amount: "15000",
      due_date: "2025-11-28",
      loan_type: "Auto Loan",
      company_name: "Chase Bank",
    },
  },
  {
    userName: "Sarah Johnson",
    userPhoneNumber: "447700123456", // UK
    metaData: {
      customer_id: "CUST_11111",
      account_number: "ACC111222333",
      due_amount: "18500",
      due_date: "2025-12-05",
      loan_type: "Mortgage",
      company_name: "Barclays Bank",
    },
  },
];

// Execute batch call
initiateBatchCall(
  "b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac",
  users,
  "https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback"
);
```

```python Python
import requests
import json

def initiate_batch_call(campaign_id, users, notification_webhook_url=None):
    """
    Initiate batch calls to multiple contacts

    Args:
        campaign_id (str): Campaign ID to link calls
        users (list): List of user objects with phone numbers and metadata
        notification_webhook_url (str, optional): Webhook URL for batch updates

    Returns:
        dict: Response with batch details and call statuses
    """

    url = "https://vb-seamless-dev-backend.oriserve.com/initiateBatchCall"

    payload = {
        "campaignId": campaign_id,
        "users": users
    }

    if notification_webhook_url:
        payload["notificationWebhookUrl"] = notification_webhook_url

    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": "Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE"
    }

    try:
        response = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers)
        response.raise_for_status()

        result = response.json()
        print(f"{result['data']['calls_initiated']} calls initiated successfully")
        print(f"Batch ID: {result['data']['batch_id']}")

        return result['data']

    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Batch call failed: {e}")
        if hasattr(e, 'response') and e.response is not None:
            print(f"Error details: {e.response.text}")
        raise

# Example usage
users = [
    {
        "userName": "Rajesh Kumar",
        "userPhoneNumber": "919876543210",  # India
        "metaData": {
            "customer_id": "CUST_12345",
            "account_number": "ACC789123456",
            "due_amount": "25000",
            "due_date": "2025-12-15",
            "loan_type": "Personal Loan",
            "company_name": "HDFC Bank"
        }
    },
    {
        "userName": "Ahmed Al-Rashid",
        "userPhoneNumber": "971501234567",  # UAE
        "metaData": {
            "customer_id": "CUST_22222",
            "account_number": "ACC444555666",
            "due_amount": "32000",
            "due_date": "2025-11-30",
            "loan_type": "Business Loan",
            "company_name": "Emirates NBD"
        }
    }
]

# Execute batch call
result = initiate_batch_call(
    campaign_id="b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac",
    users=users,
    notification_webhook_url="https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback"
)
```

```php PHP
<?php

function initiateBatchCall($campaignId, $users, $notificationWebhookUrl = null) {
    $url = "https://vb-seamless-dev-backend.oriserve.com/initiateBatchCall";

    $payload = [
        "campaignId" => $campaignId,
        "users" => $users
    ];

    if ($notificationWebhookUrl) {
        $payload["notificationWebhookUrl"] = $notificationWebhookUrl;
    }

    $headers = [
        "Content-Type: application/json",
        "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE"
    ];

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt_array($ch, [
        CURLOPT_URL => $url,
        CURLOPT_POST => true,
        CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => json_encode($payload),
        CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $headers,
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false
    ]);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    curl_close($ch);

    if ($httpCode === 200) {
        $result = json_decode($response, true);
        echo "{$result['data']['calls_initiated']} calls initiated successfully\n";
        echo "Batch ID: {$result['data']['batch_id']}\n";
        return $result['data'];
    } else {
        echo "Batch call failed: HTTP $httpCode\n";
        echo "Response: $response\n";
        return false;
    }
}

// Example usage with international numbers
$users = [
    [
        "userName" => "Rajesh Kumar",
        "userPhoneNumber" => "919876543210", // India
        "metaData" => [
            "customer_id" => "CUST_12345",
            "account_number" => "ACC789123456",
            "due_amount" => "25000",
            "due_date" => "2025-12-15",
            "loan_type" => "Personal Loan",
            "company_name" => "HDFC Bank"
        ]
    ],
    [
        "userName" => "Sarah Johnson",
        "userPhoneNumber" => "447700123456", // UK
        "metaData" => [
            "customer_id" => "CUST_11111",
            "account_number" => "ACC111222333",
            "due_amount" => "18500",
            "due_date" => "2025-12-05",
            "loan_type" => "Mortgage",
            "company_name" => "Barclays Bank"
        ]
    ]
];

// Execute batch call
$result = initiateBatchCall(
    "b885b212-d3bb-482f-a29d-508d2a8929ac",
    $users,
    "https://your-webhook.ngrok-free.app/batch-callback"
);
?>
```

</CodeGroup>

---

## Best Practices

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Phone Number Optimization" icon="phone">
    - **Always include country code** (91 for India, 1 for USA/Canada, etc.)
    - **Remove all formatting** (no spaces, dashes, or parentheses)
    - **Never use + prefix** - the system handles international dialing
    - **Validate before sending** to reduce failed calls and improve success rates
  </Accordion>

{" "}
<Accordion title="Batch Size Optimization" icon="layer-group">
  - **Small batches (10-50):** Better for testing and immediate feedback -
  **Medium batches (100-500):** Ideal for regular campaigns - **Large batches
  (500-1000):** Best for major outreach campaigns - **Monitor webhook
  responses** to track batch processing status
</Accordion>

{" "}
<Accordion title="Error Handling" icon="triangle-exclamation">
  - **Check response status** - partial success is possible - **Parse individual
  call results** for specific failure reasons - **Retry failed calls** with
  corrected phone numbers - **Use webhook notifications** for real-time status
  updates
</Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Performance Tips" icon="rocket">
    - **Use Static Batch Tokens** for production (never expire)
    - **Implement exponential backoff** for rate limiting
    - **Set up webhook endpoints** to avoid polling for status
    - **Cache campaign IDs** to avoid repeated lookups
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

---
